{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine the correct answer, we need to identify the methods used to prevent mother-to-child transmission of HIV. From the provided documents, we can see that the following interventions are mentioned: primary prevention of HIV infection in parents-to-be, early identification of seropositivity in pregnant women, prevention of unwanted pregnancies, appropriate antiretroviral therapy, special interventions in maternal management during labor, appropriate care and follow-up of the newborn, and prevention of breastfeeding transmission when alternatives are available. Based on this information, we can eliminate options A, B, and C as they are mentioned as interventions to prevent transmission. The correct answer is D, stopping breastfeed, as breastfeeding is mentioned as a mode of transmission when alternatives are not available.", "answer_choice": "D"}
